author: Staff Reporter
text:
Collector K. Veera Raghava Rao on Tuesday inaugurated the distribution of mobile phones to trainers of self-help groups (SHG) through the recently launched ‘Amma’ mobile phone scheme of the State government.

A total of 460 trainers working under Tamil Nadu State Rural Livelihood Mission with various 6,812 SHGs operating across district were given mobile phones.

Special applications in Tamil have been installed in these mobile phones which will enable the trainers to supervise some of the aspects of the functioning of SHGs.

The district administration organised a two-day training on Tuesday and Wednesday for the trainers on using the phone and the applications.
title: ‘Amma’ mobile phones distributed
